  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (** Parametric diffing

  18.     This module implements diffing over lists of arbitrary content.
  19.     It is parameterized by
  20.     - The content of the two lists
  21.     - The equality witness when an element is kept
  22.     - The diffing witness when an element is changed

  24.     Diffing is extended to maintain state depending on the
  25.     computed changes while walking through the two lists.

  27.     The underlying algorithm is a modified Wagner-Fischer algorithm
  28.     (see <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wagner%E2%80%93Fischer_algorithm>).

  30.     We provide the following guarantee:
  31.     Given two lists [l] and [r], if different patches result in different
  32.     states, we say that the state diverges.
  33.     - We always return the optimal patch on prefixes of [l] and [r]
  34.       on which state does not diverge.
  35.     - Otherwise, we return a correct but non-optimal patch where subpatches
  36.       with no divergent states are optimal for the given initial state.

  38.     More precisely, the optimality of Wagner-Fischer depends on the property
  39.     that the edit-distance between a k-prefix of the left input and a l-prefix
  40.     of the right input d(k,l) satisfies

  42.     d(k,l) = min (
  43.      del_cost + d(k-1,l),
  44.      insert_cost + d(k,l-1),
  45.      change_cost + d(k-1,l-1)
  46.     )

  48.    Under this hypothesis, it is optimal to choose greedily the state of the
  49.    minimal patch transforming the left k-prefix into the right l-prefix as a
  50.    representative of the states of all possible patches transforming the left
  51.    k-prefix into the right l-prefix.

  53.    If this property is not satisfied, we can still choose greedily a
  54.    representative state. However, the computed patch is no more guaranteed to
  55.    be globally optimal.
  56.    Nevertheless, it is still a correct patch, which is even optimal among all
  57.    explored patches.

  59. *)

  61. (** The core types of a diffing implementation *)
  62. module type Defs = sig
  63.   type left
  64.   type right
  65.   type eq
  66.   (** Detailed equality trace *)

  68.   type diff
  69.   (** Detailed difference trace *)

  71.   type state
  72.   (** environment of a partial patch *)
  73. end

  75. (** The kind of changes which is used to share printing and styling
  76.     across implementation*)
  77. ‌type change_kind =
  78.   | Deletion
  79.   | Insertion
  80.   | Modification
  81.   | Preservation
  82. ‌val prefix: Format.formatter -> (int * change_kind) -> unit
  83. ‌val style: change_kind -> Misc.Color.style list


  86. ‌type ('left,'right,'eq,'diff) change =
  87.   | Delete of 'left
  88.   | Insert of 'right
  89.   | Keep of 'left * 'right *' eq
  90.   | Change of 'left * 'right * 'diff

  92. ‌val classify: _ change -> change_kind

  94. (** [Define(Defs)] creates the diffing types from the types
  95.     defined in [Defs] and the functors that need to be instantatied
  96.     with the diffing algorithm parameters
  97. *)
  98. module Define(D:Defs): sig
  99.   open D

  101.   (** The type of potential changes on a list. *)
  102.   type nonrec change = (left,right,eq,diff) change
  103.   type patch = change list
  104.   (** A patch is an ordered list of changes. *)

  106.   module type Parameters = sig
  107.     type update_result

  109.     val weight: change -> int
  110.     (** [weight ch] returns the weight of the change [ch].
  111.         Used to find the smallest patch. *)

  113.     val test: state -> left -> right -> (eq, diff) result
  114.     (**
  115.        [test st xl xr] tests if the elements [xl] and [xr] are
  116.         co  mpatible ([Ok]) or not ([Error]).
  117.     *)

  119.     val update: change -> state -> update_result
  120.     (**  [update ch st] returns the new state after applying a change.
  121.          The [update_result] type also contains expansions in the variadic
  122.          case.
  123.      *)
  124.   end

  126.   module type S = sig
  127.     val diff: state -> left array -> right array -> patch
  128.     (** [diff state l r] computes the optimal patch between [l] and [r],
  129.         using the initial state [state].
  130.     *)
  131.   end


  134.   module Simple: (Parameters with type update_result := state) -> S

  136.   (** {1 Variadic diffing}

  138.       Variadic diffing allows to expand the lists being diffed during diffing.
  139.       in one specific direction.
  140.   *)
  141.   module Left_variadic:
  142.     (Parameters with type update_result := state * left array) -> S

  144.   module Right_variadic:
  145.     (Parameters with type update_result := state * right array) -> S

  147. end
